title: Inserisci pdf nel corpo della mail
content: Buongiorno, ho necessità di inserire un pdf nel corpo della mail. Esattamente come è possibile farlo con un'immagine. In quel caso, all'interno della mail, seleziono il menu Inserisci poi seleziono immagine e me la inserisce come fosse incollata all'interno dove solitamente si scrive il testo. Vorrei fare la stessa cosa con un pdf perché mi permette di gestire dei collegamenti mentre l'immagine no. Grazie Fabrizio Rossi. lasu@lasu.it

title: Thunderbird emails
content: This is probably a very fundamental question for Thunderbird. Please bear with me. Other Mail systems I have used have had an 'All Documents' facility which searches for keywords across all Folders. This is useful if you can't remember where you had filed a particular email. Just tell me - does this already exist somewhere on Thunderbird please?
creator: M.JEFFERY979

title: Encryption and Signing certificates not found when using IdenTrust PKI token
content:
I am using Thunderbird 91.13.1 (and I have tried to install the latest version of thunderbird as well and still get the same error) and am on a MacBook running macOS Ventura V13.3.1

I am using an IdenTrust PKI hardware token that has a digital cert for encryption and signing.

When I go into my thunderbird account settings>end-to-end encryption, I am able to select my hardware token for digital signing cert and encryption cert. But then when I go to send an encrypted or signed email I get the following error:

Sending of the message failed. You specified that this message should be digitally signed, but the application either failed to find the signing certificate specified in your Mail & Newsgroup Account Settings, or the certificate has expired

I am 100% certain that my certs are valid and have not expired.

And idea on what might be going wrong?
creator: cjdubois

title: How to stop Thunderbird going straight to browser when clicking links
content: I am looking at houses several times a day as they come in on emails. I was hoping there was an alteration in the settings that when clicking on a link it opens that link in the browser, but I don't lose focus from Thunderbird. There could be a hundred emails with house details, and I need to go through them methodically. What would be great to do, is click on the link if interested in the house details and then delete the email. Leaving me opening the new email with more house details, whilst the browser stays in the background. When I have completed the emails, I look on my browser at the ones I found interesting. Is there such a setting or addon for this? I hope I have put this succinctly? Thanks for reading, hope there is an answer.

title: Move cache folder in thunderbird 102.11.0
content:
I would like to move the Thunderbird caches to a dedicated folder.

I have moved my profile into a dedicated folder to back it up together with all my other data. This happens via automated file change detection. To keep the configuration of the backup solution simple and robust, but also save on unnecessary work and data transfer, I would like the cache folder to not be in the profile folder.

To achieve this, I have tried the "browser.cache.disk.parent_directory" config string. This does not appear to work - on startup it did not create any files in the specified directory, nor did it create the directory when I deleted the prepared directory.

Is there a way to move the cache? Did I maybe just make a mistake?
creator: RasRas2

title: Get Messages stops working frequently
content:
TB has been extremely finicky the past few days with send and receive. The biggest issue is that the Get Messages / Get All New Messages stops responding altogether - it works fine, and then suddenly nothing except (sometimes) the word "null" next to the online icon at the bottom left, and a pulsating blue progress bar in the Activity Manager area, that disappears after a moment.

A few times I have been able to "fix" it by going to Server Settings and changing Connection Security to None temporarily, but this doesn't work every time.

Another "solution" is to change the password on the mail server, which prompts TB to demand the PW. This is not a good solution, as the password must then be changed on any/every other device that connects to the mail server, and then the problem repeats after some period.

Other times, and per a suggestion on another thread with a similar subject line, clicking on the "go offline" icon at the bottom, generates a prompt to download emails before going offline, and this seems to cause a demand for password, which allows emails to be downloaded, but this also seems like a band-aid. What is going on here? Windows 10 64 Bit TB 102.11.0 (64-bit)
creator: craigbaker

title: connecting thunderbird to microsoft 365 email account
content:
I have upgraded to the Microsoft 365 Business Professional email service which should allow me to continue with Thunderbird, now that basic authentication is no longer supported.

I have enabled Exchange settings. Also, POP/IMAP and SMTP are authorized in the MS 365 account, and those setting are correct in T-Bird. From within Thunderbird, a login screen for the MS 365 email account is generated when T-Bird attempts to log in to the server, but the log in just takes me to the server page in the browser.

This help article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202 advises that Thunderbird may need to be authorized. I followed the link, but was not able to make it work.

Given the following provided link, what is to be used for {tenant-id} ? https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/adminconsent?client_id=9e5f94bc-e8a4-4e73-b8be-63364c29d753

Any other advice? Thank you very much!
creator: mgedde

title: I Like TB a Lot, but 3 things not so much.
content:
In order of priority: 1. Disable Keyboard Shortcuts/Hot Keys. I have no need for them, and just recently, after many years, I manage to get the cursor to jump to an Address Field or to the middle of the text I'm typing......then I have to find the text I've typed in the middle of nowhere, and look at the Address Field before I send a message to someone I don't want to send to. This takes up a lot of time, and proofing and proofing and proofing. 2. TB has gotten a Lot better with embedded Photos, but still can't copy a photo back to it's source for additional editing. So it's always a good idea to save the original source in a readily available place, just in case. If TB could copy photos from it's text field like standard Windows apps do, that would be a nice improvement. 3. I paste text into TB from who knows where, a newspaper, a website. Invaviably the Font Style, Size, etc is different. And TB's non-standard text design has a hard time. I've learned to copy everything to Notepad to fix it up. It's easy to do, so this is not too important as the 1st 2.

So Thanks Thunderbirders, I don't think there's a better email client.
creator: mmpiehl

title: Mozilla Thunderbird / Lightning Interfacing with Apple OS / Calendar
content:
To all, I have been having a long-time issue with my remote biz partner who is in the Apple ecosystem. Whenever I send him a calendar into to an event, he cannot get it to populate into his Apple calendar. This is what he sees when opening up the invite.

I am sure there's an easy fix such that he can click on my invite sent through Thunderbird/Lightning and get it to automatically populate his Apple calendar. Could someone help, thanks.

title: Message Rules false positives/misfiling
content:
I have a very large Message Rules set that I use to file incoming messages into various folders in my inbox. All rules filter on the 'from' field only.

Recently TB has started putting emails from some, but not all, new (to me) email addresses in one specific folder. I've very carefully checked, and the 'from' words in the new emails being moved have no intersection with the words in my filter list for that folder. The rules are otherwise working fine. The misfiled messages are often order confirmations, notices from forums about password resets, etc. What might be causing this?

Thunderbird 102.11.0 on Windows 10 22H2

title: Lost emails and combined emails
content:
Ocassionally, when I put an email into a folder (e.g. trash, custom folder, etc.) it won't be there when I check. I've checked folders above and below to ensure that I haven't mishandle the email. If I check "All mail", "Important mail" it will be there. Sometime it will not even be there. Never know when it is going to happen.

The other issue is that sometimes several emails will be combined into what looks like 1 email message. I'll click on the message to open and several other emails will be there also. I suspect this may be due to that these other emails have replied to my original message instead of sending a stand alone email. Then sometimes when I file one of these replies into a folder, they disappear.
creator: rmueda

title: Disappearance of existing entries in an address book when a new one is dropped into it from the primary list.
content: I'm using version 102 of Thunderbird. I have set up a number of subsidiary address books in Thunderbird under my Personal Address Book. In the past, I could drag and drop an entry from my primary Personal Address Book. When I clicked on the target address book, the new entry would display, along with the others previously there. With this current version of Thunderbird, I can still drag and drop, but when I click on the subsidiary address book, the only entry is the one I just copied. All the previous ones are no longer displayed. After a lot of angst and re-typing of entries, I accidentally discovered that the entries still exist, including the new one. But I have to completely cancel out of Address Book and then select it again. Now all entries are displayed. I can't believe that I'm the only one with this problem, but I haven't seen any reference to it from others.
creator: Raoul_Drapeau

title: How Do I Stop Threading Across All Accounts and Folders
content:
I have been struggling to find a better email experience on my Mac. this is the 5th application I've tested out.

I have about 7, or so, different email accounts, each with folders. Threading is automatically enabled on all of them and it's awful.

I've read through a number of questions and online posts about preventing it per folder. I have too many folders for this to work. Fixing one folder and trying to apply to all children doesn't seem to work either.

I've read about a few config options to change, but none of them seem to make a difference (e.g., mailnews.default_view_flags).

Has anyone found a way to permanently and completely disable threading?

Thanks in advance.
